Object Detection

Terminologiesâ€¢Imageclassificationinvolvespredictingtheclassofoneobjectinanimage.â€¢Objectlocalizationreferstoidentifyingthelocationofoneormoreobjectsinanimageanddrawinga boundingboxaroundtheirextent.â€¢Objectdetectioncombinesthesetwotasksandlocalizesandclassifiesoneormoreobjectsinanimage.

Terminologiesâ€¢Image Classification: Predict the type or class of an object in an image.â€¢Input: An image with a single object, such as a photograph.â€¢Output: A class labelâ€¢Object Localization: Locate the presence of objects in an image and indicate their location with a bounding box.â€¢Input: An image

location with a bounding box.â€¢Input: An image with one or more objects, such as a photograph.â€¢Output: One or more bounding boxesâ€¢Object Detection: Locate the presence of objects with a bounding box and types or classes of the located objects in an image.â€¢Input: An image with one or more objects,
image.â€¢Input: An image with one or more objects, such as a photograph.â€¢Output: One or more bounding boxes

Semantic Segmentationâ€¢U-NET Architecture:â€¢Each pixel has a vector with the length of #classes (in this example 3 classes).â€¢Each element in this vector indicates how likely it belongs to that class it represents. 0.80.10.1

Semantic Segmentationâ€¢U-NET Architecture:â€¢Each pixel has a vector with the length of #classes (in this example 3 classes).â€¢Each element in this vector indicates how likely it belongs to that class it represents.â€¢If you take argmax you can visualize the segmentation map.
